funding_code: (GRANT ONLY) HURRICANES HIM WATER ONLY
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to assist the community aqueduct "Acueducto Garzas Juncos, Inc." This system is located in the Municipality of Adjuntas and serves approximately 200 families. The aqueduct does not have a reliable back-up generator. During the Hurricane Maria recovery, the system had no electric power for 200 days and had to operate with a power generator. The 16 years old generator was repaired various times and broke down due to overuse. The purpose of these funds is to acquire a 20 kilowatts (kW) power generator as a preventive measure. The project also includes professional installation, an automatic transfer switch and water pumps to guarantee a reliable water supply in case of another emergency.

funding_code: (GRANT ONLY) HURRICANES HIM WATER ONLY
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to assist the "Comunidad Garzas Centro Aeropuerto, Inc.". This rural water system is located in the Municipality of Adjuntas, Puerto Rico and serves a population of 120 people. The Passage of Hurricane Maria on September 20, 2017 left Puerto Rico in devastation. The power grid was totally down which left 100 percentof the Island with no electricity and 60 percentwith no water. The Garzas Community sustained a lack of power for over seven months. This made it impossible for the system to provide safe reliable drinking water to its residents, including children and elderly. This project consists in the purchase and professional installation of a 20kw power generator to ensure that this aqueduct system is in a much better position to face any natural disaster in the future.

borrower_name: Comunidad Gabino Negron del Barrio Cerro Gordo de Aguada, P.R., Inc.
funding_code: (GRANT ONLY) HURRICANES HIM WATER ONLY
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to provide additional funding to cover an increase in the generator price for the Gabino Negrn Community Rural Aqueduct System located in the Cerro Gordo Ward in the Municipality of Aguada. This system is the only source of drinking water for this community of approximately 1,000 residents. Due to the passing of Hurricane Mara, the Islands power grid totally collapsed, leaving many rural communities up to a year with no electric power. In addition to this, a series of earthquakes and aftershocks have been impacting Puerto Rico since December 2019. This has provoked the complete shutdown one of the sources of electric power to the south western region of the island The project consists in the purchase and installation of an emergency generator and the reimbursement of funds expended to address damages caused by Hurricane Maria. The project has previously been granted funds in the amount of $45,943.00 to finance the project, but inflation has caused prices to go up, and additional funds will be required. The installation of the generator will provide back-up energy when needed, ensuring the system has access to a continuous source of safe, reliable water, and maintain the adequate quantities that meet the standards set by the Safe Drinking Water Act.

funding_code: (GRANT ONLY) HURRICANES HIM WATER ONLY
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to help "Acueducto Madriguera, Inc." make improvements to its community aqueduct in the Municipality of Aguas Buenas. Hurricane Maria damaged the water distribution lines. In addition, the communitys electrical infrastructure and road access were severely damaged, limiting access to maintenance crews. This left the community without electric power for eight months. This grant will be used to replace the power generator, repair the distribution lines, and replace the transfer switch, pump control panel, generator room door, and window covering where the generator is housed to protect the system from the elements.

funding_code: (GRANT ONLY) HURRICANES HIM WATER ONLY
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to help the rural aqueduct "Comunidad Corujas Inc." make improvements to its community water system. The community is located in Aguas Buenas, Puerto Rico and serves a population of 783. After the passing of Hurricane Maria, the area of Las Corujas endured a period of eight months with no electric service. They had to struggle to provide their customers limited service from its main well with an obsolete power generator which broke down due to the continuous use. This project consists in acquiring a 60KV power generator for the primary pump station and a 40KV for the secondary station. Each generator will include the transfer switch, electrical installation and the start-up. The doors will be replaced for security purposes and mesh panels will be installed over hole openings in masonry blocks to protect the systems. Once this project is complete, the aqueduct will be in a much better position to provide its clients with safe drinking water in the event of any disasters the future.

funding_code: (GRANT ONLY) HURRICANES HIM WATER ONLY
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to assist the Cuyn Water Services Inc. community aqueduct located in the Municipality of Aibonito recover from the impacts of Hurricane Maria. The system has a 60,000 gallon tank that is out of service due to leakage problems with no access road and no security fence. The only water source is a 400-feet deep well with a 15 horsepower triphasic water pump with the chlorinator by injection at the source. In case of power outage, the system is operating with a borrowed 60-kw power generator with a small transfer switch panel that is burning the cables due to contact between them. The project will help ensure the community has a continuous water supply.

naics_industry_sector: Wholesale Trade (42)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to assist farmers, ranchers, and rural small businesses in developing renewable energy systems, and in making energy-efficiency improvements to their operations. A. Garcia & Company, Inc. is a small hardware wholesaler established in Arecibo, Puerto Rico. Project funds will be used for the purchase and installation of a 96.80 kilowatt (kW) solar array. This project will realize $28,701 per year in savings, and will replace 143,080 kilowatt hours (kWh) per year, which is enough electricity to power 13 homes.

borrower_name: Acueducto Comunidad Tortuguero La Tiza Inc.
funding_code: (GRANT ONLY) HURRICANES HIM WATER ONLY
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to assist the community water system "Acueducto Comunidad Tortuguero, Inc." located in the Municipality of Barranquitas which serves a population of around 260 persons. During the Hurricane Maria recovery, the community spent five months with no electric power. They were barely able to supply water on and off with an old, overused generator that eventually broke down. The project consists in acquiring a 40 kilowatts (kW) power generator with an automatic transfer switch. This will provide the system with the security of having clean and safe water during any future emergency.

funding_code: (GRANT ONLY) HURRICANES HIM WASTE DISPOSAL ONLY
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to assist the Puerto Rico Aqueduct and Sewer Authority. This agency is the government-owned corporation responsible for water quality, management and supply in Puerto Rico. On September 20, 2017, Hurricane Maria hit Puerto Rico as a category four hurricane. The strongest atmospheric disaster on the island in the last 85 years, leaving catastrophic damages throughout the jurisdiction. Sustained winds and torrential rainfall caused widespread devastation damaging powerlines. Floods and loss of electrical power caused the shutdown of most of the islands potable water and wastewater systems posing an immediate threat to the environment, public health, and safety. All the infrastructure in Puerto Rico was severely affected, including PRASAs water and wastewater plants, pump stations, wells, properties, and buildings. Proposed funds will be used to reimburse the applicant for emergency expenses incurred on several sewer facilities after the passing of Hurricane Maria in 2017.

funding_code: (GRANT ONLY) HURRICANES HIM WATER ONLY
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to help El Manantial Rural Aqueduct located in the Municipality of Caguas recover from the impacts of Hurricane Maria. The system provides water service to 128 residents. In September 2017, Hurricane Maria caused the complete collapse of the Islands power grid, leaving some rural areas with no power for over a year. On December 2019, the Island was struck by a series of earthquakes and aftershocks that provoked the complete shutdown of the Costa Sur power generator. The project will help ensure the community has a continuous water supply.

funding_code: (GRANT ONLY) HURRICANES HIM WATER ONLY
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to assist the Turabo Arriba Rural Aqueduct located in the Municipality of Caguas recover from the impacts of Hurricane Maria. The facilities of this community were greatly affected after the passage of Hurricane Maria. The local power authority lines are still very vulnerable and become affected by any atmospheric event, which causes the community to lose power continuously. The community does not have a generator and consequently, when the power goes off, the community loses access to the drinking water system. The project will help ensure the community has a continuous water supply.

program: Rural Energy for America Program Renewable Energy Systems and Energy Efficiency Improvement Loans and Grants
borrower_name: JOSE LUIS PEREZ PADIN'S DAIRY, LLC.
funding_code: MAND. RENEW ENERFY SYSTEMS GRANTS UNDER $20,000
naics_industry_sector: Agriculture, Forestry, Fishing and Hunting (11)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to help Jose Luis Perez Padins Dairy, LLC purchase and install a 40.2 kilowatt photovoltaic solar system. This project will save $12,498.64 per year. and will generate 56,812 kilowatt hours of electricity per year (99.67 percent) which is enough electricity to power five homes.

project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to assist the Puerto Rico Aqueduct and Sewer Authority. The agency is a government-owned corporation responsible for water quality, management, and supply in Puerto Rico. On September 20, 2017, Hurricane Maria hit Puerto Rico as a category four hurricane. The strongest atmospheric disaster on the island in the last 85 years, leaving catastrophic damages throughout the jurisdiction. Sustained winds and torrential rainfall caused widespread devastation damaging powerlines. Floods and loss of electrical power caused the shutdown of most of the islands potable water and wastewater systems posing an immediate threat to the environment, public health, and safety. All the infrastructure in Puerto Rico was severely affected, including PRASAs water and wastewater plants, pump stations, wells, properties, and buildings. Proposed funds will be used to reimburse the applicant for emergency expenses incurred on several sewer facilities after the passing of Hurricane Maria in 2017.

borrower_name: Asociacion de Residentes Sector La Cuesta Bo. San Diego Inc
funding_code: (GRANT ONLY) HURRICANES HIM WATER ONLY
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to assist the Asociacin de Residentes, Sector La Cuesta, Bo San Diego Inc. community aqueduct located in the Municipality of Coamo recover from the impacts of Hurricane Maria. Coamo is a mountainous region near the south of the island and the local aqueduct authority is unable to provide the infrastructure for drinking water. On September 20, 2017, Hurricane Maria caused the entire island to be without electricity service. The La Cuesta community was no exception, they spent approximately seven months without electricity or water, because they didnt have an emergency generator to supply the power during the disaster recovery. The project will help ensure the community has a continuous water supply.

funding_code: (GRANT ONLY) HURRICANES HIM WATER ONLY
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to assist the Comunidad Mana Rural Aqueduct located in the Municipality of Corozal recover from the impacts of Hurricane Maria. The aqueduct serves 2,093 residents. With the disasters of Hurricanes Irma and Hurricane Maria, the communitys electrical infrastructure and road access were severely damaged. With lack of electric power, the community needed to run the aqueduct with an emergency power generator for eight months. The community had to manage strict rationing protocols because the aqueduct was supplied with just one pump system. Because of the on going repetitive outages in the area, the residents were experiencing drinking water shortages one to three times a week. The project will help ensure the community has a continuous water supply. The project also includes minor repairs for the maintenance of its facilities.

program: SEARCH - Special Evaluation Assistance for Rural Communities and Households Grant (WEP)
borrower_name: Residentes Urbanizacion Santa Rita Fajardo Inc
funding_code: (GRANT ONLY) SEARCH GRANTS WASTE ONLY
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to assist the Santa Rita Community located in Fajardo, Puerto Rico. This community was developed in the early 2000s and consists of 269 residences. The project included housing construction, sewer collection system and a package wastewater treatment plant. At the time there was no utility sewer system close to the community. Years later in 2010 the local aqueduct and sewer authority constructed a regional wastewater treatment plant approximately 1.5 miles from the community, unfortunately, since then, the community has been suffering problems with sanitary spills. The project consists in financing a Preliminary Engineering Report and Environmental Report to evaluate practical options to manage their sanitary water system. The community seeks to identify repairs required to solve these sanitary issues. Once the repairs are complete, the community will pursue connection to the Puerto Rico Aqueduct and Sewer Authority system.

program: Rural Energy for America Program Renewable Energy Systems and Energy Efficiency Improvement Loans and Grants
funding_code: REAP-MANDATORY RENEW ENERGY SYST GRANTS
naics_industry_sector: Agriculture, Forestry, Fishing and Hunting (11)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development invetment will be used to assist farmers, ranchers, and rural small businesses in developing renewable energy systems, and in making energy-efficiency improvements to their operations. Avicola Santos, Inc. is a small poultry farm located at Aibonito, Puerto Rico. Project funds will be used for the purchase and installation of a 78.75 kilowatt (kW) PV solar system. This project will realize $25,719 per year in savings and will replace 114,307 kilowatt hours (kWh) per year (100 percent %), which is enough electricity to power 10 homes.

funding_code: (GRANT ONLY) HURRICANES HIM WASTE DISPOSAL ONLY
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to construct four new landfill cells within the lateral expansion of the Municipality of Juncos Landfill, located in the Gurabo Abajo Ward of Juncos, Puerto Rico. The Municipality is estimated to generate approximately 48,851 tons of non-hazardous solid waste every year. Hurricane Mara produced tremendous amounts of waste in the period spanning October 2017 to December 2018, and abruptly reduced the landfills lifespan by approximately 1.65 years (20 months). Consequently, the existing cell will reach its operational capacity within the next six to eight months. It also destroyed the existing cells leachate collection system, thereby creating a serious health and safety hazard for neighboring communities and placing underground aquifer systems and nearby streams at risk of leachate spillage. The new cells will feature a geo-membrane liner to trap and contain leachate. It will also manage storm waters, and methane gas generation. All of these improvements will provide the landfill system an additional 21 useful years of operation.

program: Rural Energy for America Program Renewable Energy Systems and Energy Efficiency Improvement Loans and Grants
funding_code: REAP-MANDATORY RENEW ENERGY SYST GRANTS
naics_industry_sector: Retail Trade (44-45)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to assist farmers, ranchers, and rural small businesses in developing renewable energy systems, and in making energy-efficiency improvements to their operations. Project funds will be used for the purchase and installation of a 124 kilowatt (kW) PV solar system at Farmacia San Pedro, a small drugstore located at Lajas, Puerto Rico. This project will realize $41,414 per year in savings and will replace 192,000 kilowatt hours (kWh) per year, which is enough electricity to power 17 homes.

funding_code: (GRANT ONLY) HURRICANES HIM WASTE DISPOSAL ONLY
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to make much needed improvements to the Lajas Municipal Landfill. The landfill is located in Llanos Ward with a population of 845 inhabitants. It serves the municipalities of Lajas, Sabana Grande, San German and Guanica.The landfill was impacted by both Hurricanes Irma and Maria in 2017 because the demolition of damaged property and the reconstruction process (still ongoing) has generated and will continue to generate an unprecedented amount of solid waste for the landfill. This project consists in the closure of Cell 1 (1A and 1B) with a closure cap. Three additional cells will be constructed that will meet applicable closure and operating guidelines set forth by EPA and the Puerto Rico Environmental Department to be in regulatory compliance. Cell 2 will be divided into Cell 2A and 2B in terms of construction and operation. Cell 3 will also be constructed.

funding_code: (GRANT ONLY) HURRICANES HIM WATER ONLY
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to assist the community aqueduct "Comunidad Asomante, Inc." located in the Municipality of Las Piedras. After the passing of Hurricane Mara the community spend more than six months without electricity and the existing access road suffered erosion and damage causing difficulty accessing the well without an off-road vehicle. The community doesnt have an emergency generator to attend another atmospheric emergency that leaves the community without power. This project consists in acquiring an emergency generator to guarantee water quantity in the event of any power outage or in case of another emergency. In addition, a generator room will be constructed to ensure generator safety and proper installation. Also, leveling and grading to existing the road and drainage work will be done.

funding_code: (GRANT ONLY) HURRICANES HIM WATER ONLY
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to assist the rural aqueduct "Comunidad Las Cruces, Inc." located in the Municipality of Naranjito. The system serves a population of approximately 848 people. During the Hurricane Maria recovery, the community was left with no secure water source for five months due to lack of electrical power. During that period, they occasionally received water from the National Guard and were lent a power generator for a short time. Another challenge they have faced is that since December of 2019, Puerto Rico has been impacted by a series of earthquakes and aftershocks that provoked the complete shutdown of the Costa Sur power generator, consequently, an already beaten-up power grid system has become completely unreliable. The purpose of this project is to acquire a back-up power 40 kilowatt (kW) power generator with a transfer switch and installation. This will ensure that the system has access to a continuous source of safe drinking water and maintains the adequate quantities that meet the standards set by the Safe Drinking Water Act.

borrower_name: Corporacion de Servicios de Acueducto Anones Maya (COSAAM), Inc.
funding_code: (GRANT ONLY) HURRICANES HIM WATER ONLY
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development Investment will be used to assist the community water system "Corporacion Servicios de Acueductos Anones Maya. The system provides fresh water to 350 families in the Municipality of Naranjito. In September of 2017, Hurricane Maria hit Puerto Rico and wiped out the whole Islands power grid. This left many areas with no electrical power for long months. During the recovery period the community had to use an old 30kw generator to operate the system 10 hours a day for a span of 5 months. As a result, the generator is very worn out and is not suitable to face another phenomenon such as Hurricane Maria. This project consists in replacing the 30 kilowatts (kW) generator with a new one including a transfer switch. This will enable the community to efficiently supply safe drinking water to the community in the event of any future disasters.

funding_code: DLT GRANTS - CARES ACT - EDUCATIONAL
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to establish a distance learning network between Jobos and the Centro Sor Isolina Ferr in Ponce, Puerto Rico. The project will connect teachers and students in schools in Tabaiba, Caimito and Jobos, providing educational opportunities for rural residents. It will also connect community health education staff with elderly residents in Jobos.

funding_code: (GRANT ONLY) HURRICANES HIM WATER ONLY
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to help the Comunidad Sabana Inc. rural aqueduct recover from impacts on its facility from Hurricane Maria. After the passing of Hurricane Maria in 2017, the water system was unable to provide potable water to residents for seven months due to lack of electricity. Three years later, Tropical Storm Isaiah hit the island and the power grid was affected again, leaving the aqueduct unable to provide water to its residents for five days. The project will help ensure the community has a continuous water supply.

funding_code: (GRANT ONLY) HURRICANES HIM WATER ONLY
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development Investment will be used to assist the community aqueduct "Pozo Santo Tomas de Aquino, Inc." located in Orocovis, Puerto Rico. This system provides drinking water to more than 35 families. In September of 2017, Hurricane Maria caused the entire community to spend twelve months without electricity service. The Water Mission Organization donated a small gasoline generator to the aqueduct with which they could supply water to the community four hours a day. The generator was small and not suitable for that type of work. After operating in this manner for a year, the generator broke down due from overuse. In 2020, Hurricane Isaias passed through Puerto Rico and left the community without electricity and no water again for two whole weeks. As a mitigation measure, the community made an extraordinary expense to fund the purchase of a generator to guarantee high quality water supply for the community in case of any other emergency. To this day Puerto Rico faces temporary power outages in different parts of the island due to the vulnerability of their power lines. The project consists in the reimbursement for the cost of a 20 kilowatts (kW) emergency generator that was purchased.

borrower_name: Asociacion de Residentes y Acueductos del Barrio Real Inc.
funding_code: (GRANT ONLY) HURRICANES HIM WATER ONLY
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to assist the community water system "Asociacion de Residentes y Acueductos del Barrio Real, Inc." The aqueduct is in Patillas Puerto Rico and serves a population of 136 people. The community does not have a back-up power generator, so each time there is an atmospheric event or loss of energy, the pumping system stops working. During the passage of Huracan Maria, the system was out of service for 3 months. This project consists in the acquisition of an emergency generator, including transfer switch and installation. This will ensure that the water system continues to function and provide clean and safe water to the community during any future atmospheric event.

funding_code: RBCS DEVELOPMENT GRANT
naics_industry_sector: Other Services (except Public Administration) (81)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to provide Community Entrepreneurial Training Program. During the program, participants develop or strengthen small business ventures in areas such as agriculture, artisanal jewelry, food services, and elderly care services, among many others. This project will serve the Municipality of Lares, Puerto Rico.

funding_code: RBCS ENTERPRISE GRANTS
naics_industry_sector: Other Services (except Public Administration) (81)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to provide a Community Entrepreneurial Training Program. During the program, participants develop or strengthen small businesses ventures in areas such as agriculture, artisanal jewelry, food services, and elderly care services, among many others. This project will serve Municipalities of Maunabo and Yabucoa.

funding_code: RCDI RURAL COMMUNITY DEVELOPMENT INITIATIVE GRANT
naics_industry_sector: Other or Not Defined
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to provide technical assistance to three rural communities located in the Municipalities of Cidra, Aguas Buenas and Gurabo, Puerto Rico through the non-profit organization The Center for Habitat Reconstruction, Inc. The center is dedicated exclusively to tackling the problem of vacant and abandoned properties as part of a comprehensive, cross-sectoral approach. They conduct collaborative planning activities, local government capacity building, and promote implementation strategies with aims to transform nuisance properties into assets for recovery, community redevelopment, and long-term resilience.

borrower_name: Quemados I Sector Los Ortiz Inc.
funding_code: (GRANT ONLY) HURRICANES HIM WATER ONLY
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to assist the community aqueduct "Quemados I Sector Los Ortiz, Inc." The aqueduct provides drinking water to approximately 300 people in the Municipality of San Lorenzo. After the passing of Hurricane Maria, the community was without power for three months resulting in no access to potable water.During this time, the community was dependent on water trucks supplied by the municipality. After a month, the municipality of San Lorenzo lent the community an emergency generator to energize the well pump and provide water service to the community. When power service returned, the municipality picked up the generator, leaving the community without a power backup. This project consists in purchasing a generator as a preventive measure to guarantee water quantity if loss of power in case of another emergency.

project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to help TOA Baja Hardware LLC purchase and install a 26 kilowatts photovoltaic solar system. naics_industry_sector: Other or Not Defined

funding_code: (GRANT ONLY) HURRICANES HIM WATER ONLY
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to assist the aqueduct system Vacas III located in the Municipality of Villalba, Puerto Rico recover from impacts of Hurricane Maria. The system facilities consist of a well with a three-horsepower monophasic pump and three storage tanks. The system runs by gravity and has capacity to provide water to the entire community. The system is operating 24 hours. They currently have a 7,500 watt generator as an emergency back-up, but it does not have capacity to run the water pump with necessary voltage. The project will help ensure the community has a continuous water supply.

funding_code: CF ARP EMERGENCY RURAL HEALTH CARE GRANTS - TRACK 1 & 2
naics_industry_sector: Other or Not Defined
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to recover certified losses revenue due to the COVID-19 pandemic. The eligibility criteria is met considering that the municipalitys wards are below 20,000 residents and have a median household income below the $27,750 poverty line. The applicants facility is located in a ward that is below the 5,000 resident threshold and the project is therefore eligible for 75 percent grant funding.

borrower_name: Acueducto Rural Comunidades Especiales Bayamoncito Inc
funding_code: (GRANT ONLY) HURRICANES HIM WATER ONLY
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to assist the "Comunidad Especial Bayamoncito" Rural Aqueduct located in Aguas Buenas, Puerto Rico. The aqueduct supplies drinking water to almost 200 families. After the passing of Hurricane Maria in 2017, the community spent more than a year with no electricity. During this period, they had to rely on a 35 kW to operate the water system and the generator broke down due to the overuse. The purpose of these funds is to purchase a new 20 kW generator with an automatic transfer switch. The project will also include equipment delivery, installation, and start-up. This project ensures that the aqueduct will have the ability to provide safe and reliable drinking water to their community members in the event of any future disaster.

funding_code: (GRANT ONLY) HURRICANES HIM WATER ONLY
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to purchase a power generator. The community system does not have a power generator, due to Hurricane Maria the community was without power for more than 7 months months resulting in no access to potable water. FEMA lent the aqueduct system a power generator in May 2018 until the power was restored in the area. The community also had damages to the water flow meter that needs to be replaced to comply with health department. Months after Hurricane Maria the community had to replace damage water pump and motor on August 2018.The rural aqueduct system Acueducto Comunitario Algarrobo Inc, provides clean water to 72 family residences. The system has a 30,000 gallons tank with chlorine tablet as their disinfection system that supplies water by gravity. Their only water source is one well with a 7.5 horsepower water pump at 180 feet deep extracting around 23,000 gallons a day. Currently the system does not own a power generator for emergency outages. The proposed facility after improvement will have their own 20 KW power generator with automatic transfer switch.

funding_code: (GRANT ONLY) HURRICANES HIM WATER ONLY
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to assist the rural aqueduct "Comite Comunal Corcovado Inc.," located in Aasco, Puerto Rico. The community water system consists of two well stations and supplies drinking water to approximately 160 residents. After the passing of Hurricane Maria in 2017, the community suffered months with no electric power, and the generator in each well broke down due to excessive use during the disaster recovery period. The purpose of these funds is to purchase a new15 kw power generator to be prepared in the event of another natural disaster.

program: Rural Energy for America Program Renewable Energy Systems and Energy Efficiency Improvement Loans and Grants
funding_code: MAND. RENEW ENERFY SYSTEMS GRANTS UNDER $20,000
naics_industry_sector: Health Care and Social Assistance (62)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to assist farmers, ranchers, and rural small businesses in developing renewable energy systems, and in making energy-efficiency improvements to their operations. Project funds will be used to purchase and install a 9.89 kW PV solar system. Laboratorio Clinico Roman is a locally owned medical service provider in Arecibo, Puerto Rico. This project will realize $3,420.90 per year in savings and will replace 16,290 kWh per year (53.77 percent), which is enough electricity to power 1.5 homes.

funding_code: (GRANT ONLY) HURRICANES HIM WASTE DISPOSAL ONLY
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to upgrade air quality systems. The Cabo Rojo Landfill is in full operation and in compliance with the PREQB. Air space and volume of the active cell 2-A is reaching the top elevation level (+/- 60 msl) set in the Master Closure Plans. A new Cell 2-B adjacent to the active cell is necessary for the landfill operation continuation. The construction of the new Cell 2-B will permit the suitability for continues use. Additional air volume is available in this facility within the original approved foot print. The maximum capacity of the landfill facility is estimated to be reached in Dec. 2026. The Closure Plans were developed in accordance with Rule 565 of the Puerto Rico Environmental Quality Board (PREQB) Non-hazardous Solid Waste Management Regulations (SWMRs). The municipality of Cabo Rojo proposed the construction of a new 3.5 "cuerdas" (1 "cuerda" = .97 acres) Cell 2-B for this facility in order to warranty the continuation of the managing and final disposal of the solid waste. This new Cell 2-B will be located in the original property lot of 30.24 acres, and in the foot print of the Cabo Rojo Landfill. No land acquisition in necessary for this new Cell 2-B. The construction of the new Cell 2-B for the landfill to be implemented. The fully development and description of the proposed project was based on the Cabo Rojo Closure Master Plans already approved by PREQB. Reference is made to attach Cabo Rojo Landfill Closure Plans and Report.

borrower_name: Acueducto Rural Casa de Piedra Inc.
funding_code: (GRANT ONLY) HURRICANES HIM WATER ONLY
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to purchase a power generator. The community has a 21 years old power generator that has been overused after the passing of Hurricane Maria that leave the community without electrical power for 3 months. The generator was used 12-15 hrs daily during those months. Currently the generator malfunctions and the reparation and maintenance of the equipment is expensive for the community to cover. During the devastating effects of mudslides, wind and excessive rain events caused by Hurricane Maria on September 20-22, 2017, the Community of Casa suffered the considerate damages to their access to the system, and it was challenging to maintain the 120 residences that the system provides potable water. The system consists of one well station and one water reservoir at the top of a hill to use the different elevations of both to favor the system. The community at the moment has one generator that is well out of their usable life due to the excessive use that went on the aftermath of Hurricane Maria. To obtain resilience and a robust and reliable water system, the community need a new generator to replace the wore out existing generator that they have. With the donation, the community will have a new generator that provide resilience and a more robust system, thus the 120 residents that this aqueduct serve will have access to clean, potable water at any moment.

funding_code: (GRANT ONLY) HURRICANES HIM WATER ONLY
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to provide water system upgrades. Asociacin Villas de Guavate received a direct impact from Hurricane Mara that damaged the water supply and distribution systems, thereby compromising the Communitys access to the vital resource of safe and reliable water. Continuous electrical surges from PREPA damaged the water meter of the water supply well, fallen trees severely damaged distribution lines, and strong winds damaged the tablet chlorination system. Furthermore, the water tanks structural integrity was compromised after being empty for long periods of time and due to the lack of PREPA power for a period of over six months. The water system has one tank of 30,000 gallons that uses gravity to distribute water, one monophasic pump of 2 hp at a depth of 250 feet, and a tablet chlorinator that serves as a disinfection system. The cost overrun is needed to fund increase in construction costs. Technical provider assigned to the case was no longer with NRWA in PR and nobody kept close tract of Villas de Guavate until it was reassigned to the new provider. USDA RD requested comments addressed on EJCDC then its was recommended to change to a Small Contract Agreement . After back and forth emails on the documentation needed to be provided by engineer we received a completed Small Contract on July 2022. The contract was approved by USDA Eng. Sandimary Davila. Since it has elapsed 17 months of the original construction estimate the cost of the materials have increased substantially due to congestion in the supply-chain, and a strained labor market. After restoring the system to satisfactory conditions and in compliance with construction codes, the system will be in the following end state: the water storage tank will be refurbished, supply lines and part of the distribution lines will be replaced/repaired, a water meter will be replaced, the chlorination system will be replaced, and a back-up generator that will be stored in a concrete shelter room for mitigation purposes will be installed, ensuring continuous access to safe and reliable water in future emergency situation.

borrower_name: Corporacion Acueducto Andalucia de Cayey Inc
funding_code: (GRANT ONLY) HURRICANES HIM WATER ONLY
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to assist the "Corporacion Acueducto Andalucia de Cayey, Inc" located in Cayey, Puerto Rico. The aqueduct supplies drinking water to about 220 residents. After the passing of Hurricane Mara in 2017, the community spend over six months with no electricity. During this period, they had to rely on a borrowed generator to operate the water system. When the power grid was restored, the generator was returned to the Municipality, and they currently do not have one. The purpose of these funds is to purchase a new 20kw generator with an automatic transfer switch. The project will also include equipment delivery, installation, and start-up. This project ensures that the aqueduct the ability to provide safe and reliable drinking water to their community members in the event of any future disaster. The community is also seeking reimbursement of funds used in the disaster recovery.

program: Rural Energy for America Program Renewable Energy Systems and Energy Efficiency Improvement Loans and Grants
funding_code: REAP-MANDATORY RENEW ENERGY SYST GRANTS
naics_industry_sector: Retail Trade (44-45)
naics_description: SUPERMARKETS AND OTHER GROCERY (EXCEPT CONVENIENCE) STORES
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to purchase and install a 174.2 kilowatt (kW) photovoltaic solar system.This project will realize $205,897 per year in savings and will replace 201,954 kilowatt hours (kWh) per year, which is enough electricity to power 18 homes.

funding_code: CF ARP EMERGENCY RURAL HEALTH CARE GRANTS - TRACK 1 & 2
naics_industry_sector: Health Care and Social Assistance (62)
naics_description: CONTINUING CARE RETIREMENT COMMUNITIES AND ASSISTED LIVING FACILITIES FOR THE ELDERLY
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to build the telehealth infrastructure and secure computers and printers at Guara Bi Caney. The computer lab will be available to the public in Comerio. Guara Bi Caney serves homeless males 18 years and older, where they receive permanent housing, case management, life skills training and transportation services. The homeless population served also includes veterans, individuals living with a substance abuse disorder and/or mental illness, and individuals who are living with HIV/AIDS. Guara Bi also saw the need for telehealth services for the general population in Comerio, not just clients at Guara Bi Caney. In Guara Bi Caney telehealth options have been challenging because the office is not fully equipped with the proper upgraded computer equipment and connectivity throughout the building. This project will facilitate a needed technology overhaul and provide software and infrastructure upgrades. Guara Bi also saw the need for telehealth services for the general population in Comerio, not just clients at Guara Bi Caney. In Guara Bi Caney telehealth options have been challenging because the office is not fully equipped with the proper upgraded computer equipment and connectivity throughout the building. This project will facilitate a needed technology overhaul and provide software and infrastructure upgrades.

borrower_name: Acueducto Rural Palmarito Centro Radio Oro, inc
funding_code: (GRANT ONLY) HURRICANES HIM WATER ONLY
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used for a power generator. After the passage of Hurricane Maria, the community was without power and water for 9 months. To manage the emergency, they used a 19-year-old generator that with its use for long periods of time has spent its useful life. The community have been repairing the generator on multiple occasions and is not reliable. As a preventive measure the community is in need of a generator to guarantee water quantity if loss of power in case of another emergency. The aqueduct system needs a reliable 40KW power generator with an automatic transfer switch.

funding_code: (GRANT ONLY) HURRICANES HIM WATER ONLY
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to address the generator concerns. The Non-PRASA has two old generators that have been over used after the passing of Maria. The one in transition holding tank is currently damaged and out of use and the one in the well have been repaired various times and is not reliable. After the passing of Hurricane Maria the community had to run the generators 10 hours daily for 6 months until power service was restored. As a preventive measure of facing another emergency and with the vulnerability of PR power lines that face multiple power outages that could last for days in rural areas it is necessary two 20kw power generators that will run the water system for long periods of time ensuring safe drinking water for its users in the face of another emergency.

funding_code: (GRANT ONLY) HURRICANES HIM WATER ONLY
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to purchase a power generator. Sector Los Berrios serves 180 users. After Hurricane Maria the community was without power for 9 months. To keep providing water the president brought from his personal business a power generator that was used for those 9 months and after that the municipality lent them a temporary power generator to mange power outages that the area experiments due to the vulnerability of the power system in PR. The power generator was requested and returned on April 2022; leaving the community without a reliable power generator to manage another power emergency and keep providing water service to users during outages. The system consists of two (2) wells, the first well of 420 feet deep and the second well of 700 feet. One well has a 3-hp water pump and the second well has a 2-hp water pump, both working for 12 hours a day extracting a total of 7,200 gallons daily that fills a 30,000 gallons water distribution tank with tablet chlorination that delivers the water by gravity to the 180 residents in the community. Currently the system has no power generator for outage emergencies. The system consists of 2 wells, the first well of 420 feet deep and the second well of 700 feet. One well has a 3-hp water pump and the second well has a 2-hp water pump, both working for 12 hours a day extracting a total of 7,200 gallons daily that fills a 30,000 gallons water distribution tank with tablet chlorination that delivers the water by gravity to the 180 residents in the community. The system has a 30-kW power generator with automatic transfer switch to power the two pumps.

funding_code: CF ARP EMERGENCY RURAL HEALTH CARE GRANTS - TRACK 1 & 2
naics_industry_sector: Other or Not Defined
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to assist the Municipality of Guaynabo to purchase three regular ambulances and a bariatric ambulance to primarily serve the rural population in the sectors of Guraguao, Mamey, Ro, Sonadora, and Hato Nuevo Wards. This acquisition is in response to the health challenges brought upon by the COVID-19 pandemic. As a result of this project, the municipality will be in a much better position to serve the community during current and future health crises.

funding_code: CF ARP EMERGENCY RURAL HEALTH CARE GRANTS - TRACK 1 & 2
naics_industry_sector: Other or Not Defined
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to purchase ambulances to support the Municipality of Guaynabos medical emergency services. The Municipality currently lacks sufficient capacity to deal with another pandemic and requires additional ambulance units to sustain medical services in the future.

program: Rural Energy for America Program Renewable Energy Systems and Energy Efficiency Improvement Loans and Grants
funding_code: MAND. RENEW ENERFY SYSTEMS GRANTS UNDER $20,000
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to assist farmers, ranchers, and rural small businesses in developing renewable energy systems, and in making energy-efficiency improvements to their operations. Project funds will be used to purchase and install a 22.92 kW PV solar system. PowerComm is a Renewable Energy Service provider, located at Hatillo, Puerto Rico. This project will realize $28,695 per year in savings and will replace 35,947 kWh per year, which is enough electricity to power 3 homes.

funding_code: PERSISTENT POVERTY AGRICULTURAL PRODUCT MARKET DEVELOPMENT GRANTS
naics_industry_sector: Agriculture, Forestry, Fishing and Hunting (11)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to assist with working capital activities such as labor, gas, promotion, packaging and raw material. These costs are directly related to the processing and distribution of locally produced packaged breadfruit flour based products.

borrower_name: EDEN HEALTH CENTER, CORP, GARDEN OF
funding_code: CF ARP EMERGENCY RURAL HEALTH CARE GRANTS - TRACK 1 & 2
naics_industry_sector: Health Care and Social Assistance (62)
naics_description: ASSISTED LIVING FACILITIES FOR THE ELDERLY
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to assist Garden of Eden Health Center Corp. This community-based organization is seeking to broaden access to COVID-19 testing and vaccines and provide essential healthcare services Mameyes Arriba, in Jayuya. The organization will hire two community health workers; one is a registered nurse (full-time) and the other a licensed nurse practitioner (full-time). The proposed project is titled COVID-19 Recovery Health Workers for Mameyes Arriba. The purpose of these funds is to serve an economically distressed rural community below the poverty level of the continental United States.

funding_code: (GRANT ONLY) HURRICANES HIM WATER ONLY
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used purchase a generator. Comunidad Guaraguao does not have an electric generator to face another atmospheric disaster that cause loss of power in the community. In the aftermath of Hurricaine Maria the community was without power for 6 months. The system consists of a 500-foot-deep well with a single phase 5HP pump and a water dam. It has two 25,000-gallon tanks that provide water to 88 families. This water is distributed with gravity throughout the community and is not disinfected. At this moment the well is not working, the community is using the water dam, with surface water without any treatment. Juana Diaz is a mountainous region near the south of the island. Hurricane Maria on September 20, 2017 caused the entire island to be without electricity service. The Guaraguao community was no exception, they spent approximately 6 months without electricity. The effects of Hurricane Maria in Puerto Rico were devastating, including unprecedented damage to the electrical system, and drinking water services. Hurricane Maras damage to the community Guaraguao was no exception. After the hurricane, the community was without electricity for approximately 6 months and was incommunicado for 2 weeks. Due to heavy rains and landslides, the community was incommunicado for 2 weeks. It was not until the roads were cleared that the community was able to come out for help. Since this is a mountainous region, there is also no telephone or internet signal. Before Hurricane Maria, the community used the well, due to electrical problems, the motor, the pump, and the control panel were affected. Since then, the community has only distributed surface water. The community does not have an electric generator to face the electrical energy problems that arise in the community due to atmospheric disasters and infrastructure problems in the country. Replacement of the motor, pump and control panel is recommended to get the well up and running. The installation of a 20kw generator is also recommended so that the community is more prepared for the atmospheric phenomena and the electrical energy problems of the island.

project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to assist the Municipality of Juncos to acquire a mobile medical clinic. This project will improve the health services offered in the municipalitys rural communities.

funding_code: REAP-MANDATORY RENEW ENERGY SYST GRANTS
naics_industry_sector: Retail Trade (44-45)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to purchase and install a 67.19 kilowatt (kW) photovoltaic solar system. This project will realize $20,554 per year in savings and will replace 97,876 kilowatt hours (kWh) (96.7 percent) per year, which is enough electricity to power nine homes.

funding_code: CF ARP EMERGENCY RURAL HEALTH CARE GRANTS - TRACK 1 & 2
naics_industry_sector: Wholesale Trade (42)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to acquire an ambulance. Currently, the hospital lacks an ambulance unit that can meet the demand of this service. The main reasons for this need resulted from a unit that was involved in an accident and is currently under repair and the mechanical problems experienced with one of the old ambulance units. The ambulance services is critical in the regions were the HGC is the only hospital and health care provider. This project will improve the response time during emergency transfers to other acute care organization.

funding_code: CF ARP EMERGENCY RURAL HEALTH CARE GRANTS - TRACK 1 & 2
naics_industry_sector: Other or Not Defined
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to acquire vehicle extrication equipment, an electric transport stretcher, an evacuation chair, and a cardiac monitor for an ambulance. The aforementioned items are based on the specifications of the regulations for the ambulance service in Puerto Rico by the Municipal Office of Emergency, Disaster and Medical Emergency Management of the Municipality of Moca Works for safety and rescue efforts with a comprehensive approach to provide specialized assistance and attention. This project will help improve the response time and safety to preserve health. These facilities are located on Mario Medina street in the pueblo wards of Moca.

funding_code: RECONNECT 100% GRANT INFRASTRUCTURE INVESTMENTS AND JOBS ACT
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to deploy a fiber-to-the-premises network to connect seven public schools and a person to high-speed internet in Patillas and Arroyo municipios in Puerto Rico. VPNet Inc. will make high-speed internet affordable by participating in the FCCs Lifeline and Affordable Connectivity programs. This enables VPNet to further discount the cost of broadband services to low-income households. This project will serve socially vulnerable communities in Patillas and Arroyo municipios.

funding_code: (GRANT ONLY) HURRICANES HIM WATER ONLY
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to purchase a power generator. As a preventive measure, the community is in need of a replacement of the current overused power generator to guarantee water access if loss of power in case of another emergency. Power lines in Puerto Rico are still very vulnerable and power outages are very common specially in rural areas. The aqueduct system needs a reliable 30 kilowatt (kW) power generator with an automatic transfer switch.

funding_code: (GRANT ONLY) HURRICANES HIM WATER ONLY
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to assist the Acueducto Comunidad Quebrada Arriba, Inc. located in Patillas, Puerto Rico. The aqueduct serves a population of 720 residents. After the passing of Hurricane Maria, the community was without electric power for over four months. They were able to partially operate the water system with a generator lent to them by the Municipality. Once the electric was restored in their area, the generator was returned. This project consists in acquiring a 20kw power generator, a transfer switch and additional components as a preventive measure to enable the aqueduct to function in the event of any future disaster or emergencies. They will be prepared to always provide clean and safe drinking water to the families in their communities. This project consists in acquiring a 20kw power generator, a transfer switch and additional components as a preventive measure to enable the aqueduct to function in the event of any future disaster or emergencies. They will be prepared to always provide clean and safe drinking water to the families in their communities.

borrower_name: Sistema de Agua Potable Barrio Jacaboa Sector Higuero Inc.
funding_code: (GRANT ONLY) HURRICANES HIM WATER ONLY
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to purchase a generator. After the passing of Hurricane Maria community spent 4 months without power. They use a small gasoline generator donated from water mission. which they used temporarily to provide intermittent water service. this generator started malfunctioning due to the long period of use during emergency. They dont count with an extra energy source to be prepared for PR constant power outages or another emergency that could leave the community without power for days. As a preventive measure the community is in need of a generator to guarantee water quantity if loss of power in case of another emergency. The aqueduct system needs a reliable 14 KW power generator with an automatic transfer switch

borrower_name: Asociacion De Vecinos Del Sector Los Oquendo Bo Hato Arriba de San Lorenzo Inc
funding_code: (GRANT ONLY) HURRICANES HIM WATER ONLY
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to purchase a generator. The community doesnt have a power generator. After the passing of Hurricane Maria they were without power for 9 months. The municipality lent them a power generator to manage the emergency during the power outage so the community keep providing water service. This generator was returned once power lines were restored in the area. As a preventive measure the community is in need of a generator to guarantee water quantity if loss of power in case of another emergency. The aqueduct system needs a reliable 20 KW power generator with an automatic transfer switch.

funding_code: (GRANT ONLY) HURRICANES HIM WATER ONLY
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to assist the Comunidad Emmanuelli Incs water system. This rural water system is located in the Municipality of San Lorenzo PR, and serves approximately the 20 families. San Lorenzo is a mountainous region in the southeast of the island. Hurricane Maria that passed on September 20, 2017, caused the entire island to go months without any electrical service. The effect of Hurricane Maria in Puerto Rico was devastating. This includes serious damage to electrical services and the drinking water system. The community was around 8 months without electricity. The generator that the community has is old and at present it is not working. The generator begins to have problems and is not suitable to face another phenomenon such as Hurricane Maria. Therefore, we recommend replacing the electric generator. The work consists of removing the old generator and replacing it with a new 20kw generator, which will be more efficient and with the installation of a new automatic transfer switch.

funding_code: (GRANT ONLY) HURRICANES HIM WATER ONLY
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to fund offices and water system upgrades. The Sector Los Gomez Community was approved to make repairs to their office and water system, replace damaged office equipment and to acquire an emergency generator. These funds gave the water system the ability to continue the mission of providing safe reliable drinking water to their community members. They are currently requesting additional funds in the amount of $26,300.00 as a cost overrun, to safeguard the generator with a protective shield, secured to a concrete pad in the event of any future disasters. This new project consists of the acquisition of a generator shield to be secured to a 16.5 ft. x 12 ft. floor pad in reinforced concrete. The cost includes engineering services, professional electrical installation and certification, labor, materials and taxes. There is also a reimbursement for the installation of ten (10) 5/8 in. water meters that had not been requested in the 1st phase of the project.. Once the project is completed, Sector Los Gomez Community will have a safe and resilient water system ready to serve the community in the event of any future disaster.

funding_code: CF ARP EMERGENCY RURAL HEALTH CARE GRANTS - TRACK 1 & 2
naics_industry_sector: Other or Not Defined
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to meet the demands arising from the COVID-19 pandemic that have overwhelmed the Municipality of San Villalbas medical emergency services. The Municipality requires equipment to respond to medical emergencies, including an ambulance. This project will help procure an ambulance to serve the rural population of the Municipality of San Villalba. The eligibility criteria is met considering that all of the Municipalitys wards are below 20,000 residents and have a Median household income below the $27,750 poverty line. The equipment to be acquired will be located and dispatched from the Emergency Management Center at Villalba Arriba ward, a location that is under the 5,000-resident threshold.

project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to purchase and install a 38 kW photovoltaic (PV solar) system at Hacienda Tres Angeles Inc., an agricultural producer and coffee farming operation in Ciales, Puerto Rico. The system will be connected to a battery-backup energy-storage system to ensure the business has power. The project annually will save the business $37,357 and replace 116,743 kWh (102 percent), enough energy to power 10 homes.

funding_code: (GRANT ONLY) HURRICANES HIM WATER ONLY
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to help a rural community purchase and install an emergency power generator with an automatic transfer switche that will ensure that their drinking water system can operate in the absence of electric power. After Hurricane Mara made landfall in September 2017, the community could not operate its sytem for nine months due to the collapse of Puerto Ricos electric power grid. The project will empower the community to deliver reliable drinking water services to its residents in the event of natural disasters.

borrower_name: Comunidad Cerro Gordo Sector El Parque Inc
funding_code: (GRANT ONLY) HURRICANES HIM WATER ONLY
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to assist with Hurricane Maria relief. After the passing of Hurricane Maria the community spent four months without power and utilized for extended periods of time their 40kW emergency power generator until the electrical grid was restored partially. Since then the community has been repairing their power generator but excessive use during the emergency and constant power outages thru out the island leaved the community with a malfunctioning alternative power source. Currently the power lines in PR are still very vulnerable after the passing of category five Hurricane Maria leaving the island with constant power outages with strong climates and malfunctions of the power grid.

funding_code: COMMUNITY FACILITY (DIRECT AND GUARANTEED LOANS)
naics_industry_sector: Construction (23)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to finance the improvement of existing deteriorated rural roads for the Municipality of Aguada. The affected rural communities to be improved are: Rio Grande, Cruces, Jaguey, Asomante, Atalaya, Lagunas, Guayabo, Piedras Blancas, Cerro Gordo, Malpaso, and Guanabano Wards.

funding_code: (GRANT ONLY) ECWAG - APPROPRIATED $150,000 LIMIT
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to repair damages caused by Hurricane Fiona. On September 18, 2022, Hurricane Fiona hit Puerto Rico as a category one (1) hurricane. Sustained winds and torrential rainfall caused widespread devastation damaging powerlines. Floods and loss of electrical power caused the shutdown of most of the islands potable water and wastewater systems posing an immediate threat to the environment, public health, and safety. Many of our infrastructure was affected, including water and wastewater plants, pumps station, wells, properties, and buildings.

borrower_name: Acueducto Comunal Sector La Sierra Del Barrio Canaboncito
funding_code: (GRANT ONLY) HURRICANES HIM WATER ONLY
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to help a rural community purchase and install three emergency power generators with automatic transfer switches that will ensure that their drinking water system can operate in the absence of electric power. In 2017 the community could not operate its system for over two weeks in the aftermath of Hurricane Maria due to the collapse of Puerto Ricos electric power grid. The project will empower the community to deliver reliable drinking water services to its residents in the event of natural disasters.

borrower_name: Acueducto Comunidad de Buenos Aires Incorporado
funding_code: (GRANT ONLY) HURRICANES HIM WATER ONLY
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to assist with Hurricane Maria relief efforts. The community suffered several damages related to Hurricane Maria in September 2017, from broken transmission and distribution lines and was very difficult to the community to provide potable water after the storm. The community have only a photovoltaic solar system as their only power source. The rural water system of Acueducto Buenos Aires have experience decline on their water supply and distribution due to the lack of an alternative or secondary power source. With the addition of a stationary diesel generator the rural water system will ensure a continuous source of power to the well station and potable water to the residents of the community.

funding_code: (GRANT ONLY) HURRICANES HIM WATER ONLY
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to assist Pozo de Agua Inc. Pozo de Agua Inc. manages, operates and maintains their own aqueduct, and have the responsibility of comply with requirements under the SDWA. The organized community is register in the Department of Health and incorporated in the Department of State. The community is located at Borinquen ward of Caguas Municipality, specifically on road PR-761 from KM 3.2 to 8.0. They supply water for an estimated of 183 clients corresponding to 530 individuals. Before Hurricane Maria, the water system consisted of two Wells, network distribution pipelines and a storage tank. Well #1 was pumping 85 GPM of water through a four-inch diameter during 10 hours per day and Well #2, 15 GPM, through a two-inch diameter pipe operated 9.5 hours.

funding_code: (GRANT ONLY) HURRICANES HIM WATER ONLY
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to obtain a generator. After Hurricane Maria, the community was without power for eight months. They responded to the emergency with a 25-year-old generator used 8-10 hours daily to provide essential water service. The generator has had multiple repairs and is past its useful life. As a preventive measure the community is in need of a reliable generator with automatic transfer switch that works with water pumps for long periods of time to guarantee water quantity if loss of power occurs during another emergency. The project will also reimburse expenses incurred to clean the clogged water well after the hurricane.

program: Rural Energy for America Program Renewable Energy Systems and Energy Efficiency Improvement Loans and Grants
funding_code: REAP IRA RES GRANT $20K AND LESS (FY 23)
naics_industry_sector: Manufacturing (31-33)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to assist Dulce Emmely, Inc., a bakery store located at Camuy, Puerto Rico, in developing renewable energy system. Project funds will be used to purchase and install a 21.36 kW PV solar system. This project will realize $10,149 per year in savings and will replace 31,469 kWh (102.32 percent) per year, which is enough electricity to power two homes.

funding_code: CF ARP EMERGENCY RURAL HEALTH CARE GRANTS - TRACK 1 & 2
naics_industry_sector: Health Care and Social Assistance (62)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to deal with the health damages caused by the COVID-19 pandemic and to increase medical surge capacity in rural areas, especially for low and moderate income who dont have access to quality health services. In order to do this, Municipality of Ceiba will acquire the following health care equipment, which is constantly requested by our residents: A bariatric ambulance which is a modified vehicle to carry the severely obese people, with a stretcher and a Skid Plate lifting gear, designed to carry weights between 771 pounds to 992 pound, as well as a trailer, fully transformed into a mobile medical unit to provide health services in the different communities. A F250 4x4 Crew Cab Pick-up, STX Work Truck will also be purchased to move the mobile medical unit through the communities.

funding_code: (GRANT ONLY) ECWAG - APPROPRIATED $150,000 LIMIT
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to repair damages caused by Hurricane Fiona. On September 18, 2022, Hurricane Fiona hit Puerto Rico as a category one (1) hurricane. Sustained winds and torrential rainfall caused widespread devastation damaging powerlines. Floods and loss of electrical power caused the shutdown of most of the islands potable water and wastewater systems posing an immediate threat to the environment, public health, and safety. Many of our infrastructure was affected, including water and wastewater plants, pumps station, wells, properties, and buildings.

funding_code: FERTILIZER PRODUCTION EXPANSION PROGRAM
naics_industry_sector: Manufacturing (31-33)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to help offset the costs associated with repairing damage done to the plant by Hurricane Maria and followed by an earthquake. The grant will be used to clean and reopen a portion of the plant that was closed and to purchase and install new equipment. The improvements will not only restore Pan American Grain Company production to previous production capacity but also increase production. Pan American Grain Company has operated in Puerto Rico for 16 years. By increasing production, they hope to improve food supply chain in Puerto Rico.

funding_code: (GRANT ONLY) ECWAG - APPROPRIATED $150,000 LIMIT
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to repair damages caused by Hurricane Fiona. On September 18, 2022, Hurricane Fiona hit Puerto Rico as a category one (1) hurricane. Sustained winds and torrential rainfall caused widespread devastation damaging powerlines. Floods and loss of electrical power caused the shutdown of most of the islands potable water and wastewater systems posing an immediate threat to the environment, public health, and safety. Many of our infrastructure was affected, including water and wastewater plants, pumps station, wells, properties, and buildings.

funding_code: (GRANT ONLY) HURRICANES HIM WASTE DISPOSAL ONLY
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used provide assistance to the solid waste landfill. The Jayuya Municipal Landfill is located off PR-144, Collores Ward, The Municipality has owned and operated the facility since 1976. The Landfill currently receives an average of 911.5 tons per month of solid waste and 10,938 tons of solid waste a year from the Municipality. The Landfill receives primarily solid waste from household and commercial sectors, construction and demolition debris, yard waste, scrap automobiles, and white goods. Currently, the municipal solid waste system, including the landfill, employs 13 individuals and receives an annual budget of $1,143,034.00 and represents 16.3% of the municipal budget. The Municipality generates approximately 48,851 tons tons of non-hazardous solid waste every year. From these, an estimate of 45,483 tons are disposed at the landfill and some 3,368 tons are recovered and diverted for reuse and/or recycling. As a result, approximately 6.9 percent rate of recovery and diversion for all waste generated in Jayuya. Hurricane Mara produced tremendous amounts of waste in the period spanning September 2017 to June 2018, and abruptly reduced the landfills lifespan by over two years (26 months). The storm dumped approximately 22,308 tons of waste in a short time span between November 2017 and January 2019. Consequently, the existing cell will reach its operational capacity within the next two to three years.

funding_code: (GRANT ONLY) HURRICANES HIM WATER ONLY
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to provide additional funding due to complications on the replacement of the damaged water pump. The contractor Walker Drilling Corp had difficulty extracting the pumping system with a crane. They decided to verify the depth of the well, which resulted in a clogged well at 241 feet from an original 400-foot depth. Findings after extraction of the pumping system included: a clogged water well, damaged pipes, and damaged electrical cables.

The service demands of the COVID-19 pandemic have overwhelmed Hospital General Castaers medical services. The employees for these units currently do not have a permanent site of work. This project will improve access to health care services.

funding_code: (GRANT ONLY) HURRICANES HIM WATER ONLY
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to assist with Hurricane Maria relief efforts. After the passing of Hurricane Maria the community spend more than six months without electricity and the access road suffered erosion and damage causing difficulty accessing the well without an off road vehicle. The community doesnt have an emergency generator to attend another atmospheric emergency that leaves the community without power. Currently the rural water system is in need of more funding due to increases in materials and labor. Comunidad Asomante The Consulting Engineer presented an updated estimate with a total project cost of $217,522 showing an increase of $36,522 in development and adjustment to 10% contingency for any project increase.

funding_code: (GRANT ONLY) HURRICANES HIM WATER ONLY
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to assist with the communitys water system. The system provides potable water to 278 residences. At the moment of the disaster the community had two power generators one for the well system and other to power the booster pump to continue working. The community bought the two-power generator more than 20 years ago. Due to the continuous use of the generators for 12 hours a day, the generators became unreliable and malfunction when the community experiences power outages. As a preventative measure, the community is in need of two reliable power generators with automatic transfer.

A total of 28 units will be purchased and distributed among the Municipal Emergency Management Office, Municipal Public Works Department, Municipal Police Department and Sanitation Department to improve the services provided to citizens in rural areas.

funding_code: (GRANT ONLY) HURRICANES HIM WATER ONLY
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be use to help Comunidad las Cruces, Inc. Comunidad las Cruces, Inc. has two well stations. The well station #1 has 25 hp submersible pump that has a 40kw generator donated thru FY21 HIM Funds and the well station #2 has a 3.5 hp pump station. The community extracts approximate of 54 gallons per minute, with both well stations in operation. The total extraction per day of the rural aqueduct is 48,960 gallons. That is a limited extraction capacity due to the 225 residences or approximate 900 people that the community serve, based on the PRASA design guidelines. Currently, the second well station does not have a generator and when power outages occur, they cannot provide service to the whole community.

program: SEARCH - Special Evaluation Assistance for Rural Communities and Households Grant (WEP)
funding_code: (GRANT ONLY) SEARCH GRANTS WATER ONLY
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to help Comunidad Las Cruces make well system improvements. The community consist of 189 connections. The current well is not providing sufficient water extraction for the residents they serve. The community contemplated various options with the well station like cleaning the borehole and re-drilling the well. However, all attempts did not solve the extraction problem. Comunidad Las Cruces will have a PER and Environmental Report that will provide viable alternatives to resolve non-sufficient water extraction issues.

funding_code: (GRANT ONLY) HURRICANES HIM WATER ONLY
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to purchase a backup 20 kW power generator. The community received a 40 kW power generator that gives backup energy to most of the connections. The other segment of connections, joined through an inline water pump at the water-tank reservoirs elevation, does not receive backup energy during power outages. This segment needs a generator for emergency backup power. Comunidad Sabana Inc. has 165 connections for approximately 445 residents.

funding_code: (GRANT ONLY) HURRICANES HIM WATER ONLY
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This USDA Rural Development investment of $30,000.00 will help a rural community purchase and install an emergency power generator with an automatic transfer switche that will ensure that their drinking water system can operate in the absence of electric power. After Hurricane Mara made landfall in September 2017, the community could not operate its sytem due to the collapse of Puerto Ricos electric power grid. The project will empower the community to deliver reliable drinking water services to its residents in the event of natural disasters.
