funding_code: (GRANT ONLY) ECWAG - APPROPRIATED $150,000 LIMIT
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to repair damages caused by Hurricane Fiona. On September 18, 2022, Hurricane Fiona hit Puerto Rico as a category one (1) hurricane. Sustained winds and torrential rainfall caused widespread devastation damaging powerlines. Floods and loss of electrical power caused the shutdown of most of the islands potable water and wastewater systems posing an immediate threat to the environment, public health, and safety. Many of our infrastructure was affected, including water and wastewater plants, pumps station, wells, properties, and buildings.

project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to help purchase and install a 30 kW photovoltaic (PV) solar system connected to a battery-backup energy-storage system to ensure power at Wilfredo Rodriguez DBA El Rey Sport Bar, a restaurant in Rio Grande, Puerto Rico. The project annually will save $15,188 and replace 46,021 kWh, enough energy to power four homes.

funding_code: PERSISTENT POVERTY AGRICULTURAL PRODUCT MARKET DEVELOPMENT GRANTS
naics_industry_sector: Agriculture, Forestry, Fishing and Hunting (11)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to help Nestor Reyes Farm & Associates Inc, a farm located in Rio Grande, Puerto Rico, in the production and marketing of packaged eggs. The eggs will be packaged in translucent cartons with appropriate branding, labels, and nutritional information, making them ready for commercialization. This project is expected to create 10 jobs.

program: Meat and Poultry Intermediary Lending Program (MPILP)
borrower_name: FONDO DE INVERSION Y DESARROLLO COOP
funding_code: MEAT & POULTRY IRP GRANTS - ARPA
naics_industry_sector: Finance and Insurance (52)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to help assist with the construction of two meat slaughter and processing plants, one for swine and one for bovine. This project will also help fund three poultry production warehouses to increase the availability of chickens for grilling. These initial projects will allow additional fresh and more affordable meat and poultry products for local customers. The revolving loan fund will be administered by Fondo de Inversion y Desarrollo Cooperative, Inc (FIDECOOP) who administers a host of other investments that support businesses in Puerto Rico. The new fund will give them another tool to use to strengthen the financial capacity of local cooperatives focused on meat and poultry production.

funding_code: RBCS ENTERPRISE GRANTS
naics_industry_sector: Other Services (except Public Administration) (81)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to serve the rural communities in the Eastern tourism region of Puerto Rico. This project offers customized activities and events to promote innovative solutions that address the challenges faced by the tourist industry, particularly in the growth of the local visitor economy. These solutions include managing community tourism assets, improving mobility, implementing signage and wayfinding, expanding lodging options, developing new attractions (experiences or services), and creating business clusters.

funding_code: RBCS ENTERPRISE GRANTS
naics_industry_sector: Professional, Scientific, and Technical Services (54)
naics_description: ADMINISTRATIVE MANAGEMENT AND GENERAL MANAGEMENT CONSULTING SERVICES
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to provide technical assistance to 76 businesses in rural municipalities of Puerto Rico. The project focuses on rural business competitiveness and innovation. It will help small manufacturing and retail businesses with marketing and sales, process improvement, and leadership and workforce development.

borrower_name: FONDO DE INVERSION Y DESARROLLO COOP
funding_code: RBCS ENTERPRISE GRANTS
naics_industry_sector: Finance and Insurance (52)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to provide technical assistance and leadership training to twenty rural cooperatives in Puerto Rico. The project will improve the cooperatives knowledge of federal-funds management and pre-and post- grantsmanship. Ten rural cooperatives also will receive an energy-assessment-and-audit feasibility study with procedures, analyses, and recommendations for energy conservation. The project will help ensure rural residents have access to energy conservation programs that will help expand community services. It will create 40 jobs.

program: Rural Energy for America Technical Assistance Grant Program
funding_code: REAP IRA TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE GRANTS
naics_industry_sector: Other Services (except Public Administration) (81)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to provide technical assistance for stakeholders interested in Rural Energy for America Program (REAP) Renewable Energy System and Energy Efficiency Improvement opportunities for rural small businesses and agricultural producers throughout the rural area of Puerto Rico.

program: Rural Energy for America Technical Assistance Grant Program
funding_code: REAP IRA TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE GRANTS
naics_industry_sector: Professional, Scientific, and Technical Services (54)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to provide technical assistance for stakeholders interested in Rural Energy for America Program (REAP) Renewable Energy System and Energy Efficiency Improvement opportunities for rural small businesses and agricultural producers throughout the southwest area of Puerto Rico.

borrower_name: FONDO DE INVERSION Y DESARROLLO COOP
funding_code: SMALL SOCIALLY DISADVANTAGED PRODUCER GRANT
naics_industry_sector: Finance and Insurance (52)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to provide technical assistance to four Hispanic cooperatives situated in rural areas of Puerto Rico through conducting feasibility studies and developing business plans that will determine the potential and demand for expansion, as well as the viability of construction infrastructures.

funding_code: CY 2022 PERSISTENT POVERTY RCDI GRANTS
naics_industry_sector: Other or Not Defined
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to provide technical assistance services for developing community projects and pursuing funding in the eastern part of Puerto Rico (Ceiba, Luquillo, Naguabo and Juncos).

funding_code: CY 2022 TAT GRANTS DIV N
naics_industry_sector: Other or Not Defined
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be use by Foundation for Puerto Rico to provide technical assistance for concept development and financing of a Transportation Terminus in Naguabo, Puerto Rico.

borrower_name: ASOCIACION PRO ACUEDUCTO HATO CUCHILLA INC
funding_code: (GRANT ONLY) HURRICANES HIM WATER ONLY
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to purchase a 30 kW power generator with automatic transfer switch to guarantee emergency water delivery during power outages to the local community. After Hurricane Maria the community was without power for nine months. To help the educational-services organization Asociacion Pro Acueducto Hato Cuchilla manage the emergency and supply power, the San Lorenzo municipality lent it a 30 kW generator for four months. Puerto Rico has a very vulnerable power system after Hurricane Maria and rural areas suffer from constant power outages. This generator will help supply water to many local rural residents.

funding_code: (GRANT ONLY) HURRICANES HIM WATER ONLY
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to buy an electric-power generator for Quemados II Sector Vicente, Inc. in San Lorenzo, Puerto Rico. Area residents do not have an alternative power source on the deep-well station. This investment will enable residents to have safe drinking water in their homes. This project will benefit 85 homes with approximately 400 people.

program: Rural Energy for America Program Renewable Energy Systems and Energy Efficiency Improvement Loans and Grants
borrower_name: CENTRO DE DIAGNOSTICO Y TRATAMIENTO DE S
funding_code: REAP IRA RES GRANT UNRESTRICTED (FY 22/23)
naics_industry_sector: Health Care and Social Assistance (62)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to purchase and install a 96.76 kilowatt (kW) photovoltaic solar system connected to a battery backup energy storage system to ensure the business never loses power. Centro Diagnostico y Tratamiento San Sebastin Inc. is a health service clinic center located in San Sebastin, Puerto Rico. This project will realize $42,452.00 per year in savings and will replace 142,000 kilowatt hours (kWh) (100 percent) per year, which is enough electricity to power 13 homes.

program: Rural Energy for America Program Renewable Energy Systems and Energy Efficiency Improvement Loans and Grants
funding_code: REAP IRA RES GRANT UNRESTRICTED (FY 22/23)
naics_industry_sector: Retail Trade (44-45)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to help develop renewable energy systems forNedal Hamad DBA Tiendas Inpacto, two convenience stores in Lares and San Sebastian, Puerto Rico. The funds will be used to purchase and install a 31.98 kW photovoltaic (PV) solar system connected to a battery-backup energy-storage system, helping ensure the business never loses power. The project annually will save $14,663 and replace 47,302 kWh (96 percent), enough energy to power four homes.

program: Rural Energy for America Program Renewable Energy Systems and Energy Efficiency Improvement Loans and Grants
funding_code: REAP IRA RES GRANT UNRESTRICTED (FY 22/23)
naics_industry_sector: Agriculture, Forestry, Fishing and Hunting (11)
naics_description: OTHER FOOD CROPS GROWN UNDER COVER
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to purchase and install a 62.64 kilowatt (kW) photovoltaic solar system connected to a battery backup energy storage system to ensure the business never loses power. Jos T. Roman Barcelo Inc. is a hydroponic agriculture producer located in San Sebastian, Puerto Rico. This project will realize $16,623 per year in savings and will replace 92,377 kilowatt hours (kWh) (161 percent) per year, which is enough electricity to power eight homes.

funding_code: (GRANT ONLY) ECWAG - APPROPRIATED $1,000,000 LIMIT
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to repair damages caused by Hurricane Fiona. On September 18, 2022, Hurricane Fiona hit Puerto Rico as a category one (1) hurricane. Sustained winds and torrential rainfall caused widespread devastation damaging powerlines. Floods and loss of electrical power caused the shutdown of most of the islands potable water and wastewater systems posing an immediate threat to the environment, public health, and safety. Many of our infrastructure was affected, including water and wastewater plants, pumps station, wells, properties, and buildings.

project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to purchase and install a 40.8 kilowatt (kW) photovoltaic solar system connected to a battery backup energy storage system to ensure the business never loses power. funding_code: COMMUNITY FACILITY (DIRECT AND GUARANTEED LOANS)
naics_industry_sector: Other or Not Defined
naics_description: OTHER PUBLIC BUILDING & IMPROVEMENT RELATED SERVICES
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to acquire new vehicles and equipment in the amount of $3,325,480. Over the years with the constant use, most of the fleet has been out of service, leaving only 25 percent to cover and serve all the rural areas within the municipality. The equipment available is insufficient to comply with adequate services in the rural communities of Vega Baja Municipality. The rural areas are under served and the Municipality of Vega Baja needs to acquire new vehicles and equipment in the amount of $3,325,480 from which it already contributed $876,865 and is requesting financing $2,448,615 to provide adequate services in these areas.

funding_code: REAP IRA RES GRANT UNRESTRICTED (FY 22/23)
naics_industry_sector: Construction (23)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to assist Air System Designs, LLC a rural small business located in Barceloneta, Puerto Rico, to develop renewable energy systems. Project funds will be used for the purchase and installation of a 15kW PV solar system connected to a battery backup energy storage system to ensure the business never loses power. This project will realize $14,400 per year in savings and will replace 40,320 kWh (160 percent) per year, which is enough electricity to power three homes.

funding_code: (GRANT ONLY) HURRICANES HIM WATER ONLY
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to acquire a 30 thousand volt amp electrical generator. After the passing of Hurricane Maria, the Island of Puerto Rico was left with a completely demolished power grid. In some areas, it took over a year to reestablish electric power and water. These funds will assist in the mitigation measure to ensure the ability to provide safe drinking water to Acueducto Rural Palmarito Cintron Inc.s community members in the event of any future power outages.

project_name: FY24 HIM & CY22 Funds - Landfill Expansion & Closure
funding_code: (GRANT ONLY) CY 2022 DISASTER - WASTE DISPOSAL ONLY
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to support the Municipality of Guayama in repairing its municipal solid waste landfill from the effects of Hurricane Maria in 2017 and Hurricane Fiona in 2022. The project includes the closure of the existing landfill cell, the relocation of an irrigation channel culvert, the construction of a new cell, and the creation of a recycling and bale and wrap facility.

program: Rural Energy for America Program Renewable Energy Systems and Energy Efficiency Improvement Loans and Grants
funding_code: REAP IRA RES GRANT UNRESTRICTED (FY 22/23)
naics_industry_sector: Retail Trade (44-45)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to assist JR Petroleum Corp. a rural small business located in Hatillo, Puerto Rico, in developing renewable energy systems. Project funds will be used for the purchase and installation of a 24.6 kilowatt (kW) photovoltaic (PV) solar system connected to a battery backup energy storage system to ensure the business never loses power. This project will realize $6,107 per year in savings and will replace 39,571 kilowatt hours (kWh) (187.9 percent) per year, which is enough electricity to power three homes.

naics_description: SUPERMARKETS AND OTHER GROCERY (EXCEPT CONVENIENCE) STORES
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to assist Grupo Ausubo, Inc. DBA Supermercados Mi Gente a rural small business located in Juana D az, to develop renewable energy systems. This project will help purchase and installation of a 63.3 kW PV solar system. program: Rural Energy for America Program Renewable Energy Systems and Energy Efficiency Improvement Loans and Grants
funding_code: REAP IRA RES GRANT UNRESTRICTED (FY 22/23)
naics_industry_sector: Retail Trade (44-45)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to assist Farmacia del Pueblo VEH, Inc. a rural small business located in Las Piedras, Puerto Rico, to develop renewable energy systems. Project funds will be used to purchase and install a 16.2 kW PV solar system connected to a battery backup energy storage system to ensure the business never loses power. This project will realize $7,239 per year in savings and will replace 24,945 kWh (109 percent) per year, which is enough electricity to power two homes.

project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to assist Supermercado Plaza Borinquen Aguadilla, Inc. DBA Supermercados Selectos, a rural small business located in Moca, Puerto Rico, to develop renewable energy systems. funding_code: (GRANT ONLY) HURRICANES HIM WATER ONLY
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to purchase and install an emergency power generator with an automatic transfer switch that will ensure that their drinking water system can operate in the absence of electric power. In 2017, the community could not operate its system in the aftermath of Hurricane Mari a due to the collapse of Puerto Ricos electric power grid. The project will empower the community to deliver reliable drinking water services to its residents in the event of future natural disasters.

borrower_name: Acueducto Rural de Tejas de Yabucoa Inc.
funding_code: (GRANT ONLY) HURRICANES HIM WATER ONLY
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to purchase and install two emergency power generators with automatic transfer switches that will ensure that their drinking water system can operate in the absence of electric power. In 2017, the community could not operate its system in the aftermath of Hurricane Mar a due to the collapse of Puerto Ricos electric power grid. The project will empower the community to deliver reliable drinking water services to its residents in the event of future natural disasters.
